subject: RE: [junit] assert and Java 1.4
msgSnippet: From https://sourceforge.net/project/shownotes.php?group_id=15278&release_id=3618 ... Framework Introduced Assert.assertTrue(boolean) and assertTrue(String,
messageBody:
From https://sourceforge.net/project/shownotes.php?group_id=15278&release_id=36181:
 
>>>
Framework Introduced Assert.assertTrue(boolean) and assertTrue(String, boolean) deprecated assert(boolean) and assert(String, boolean) in preparation for the assert keyword in Java 1.4. We plan to support native assertions when they are publicly available. You can either move to assertTrue() or wait for 1.4 and delete parentheses as the syntax is e.g. "assert 2 == 3".
<<<
 
ciao, Ilja
-----Original Message-----
From: Starkie, Michael [mailto:MStarkie@...]
Sent: Mittwoch, 19. September 2001 15:53
To: junit@yahoogroups.com
Subject: [junit] assert and Java 1.4

In Java 1.4 "assert" is a keyword and may not be used as an identifier,
therefore my regression test code fails to build when using java 1.4.
What is Junit going to do about it?

thanks,

mike
